title: Commission for Spencerian ornament - Suggestions?
content:
I was wondering if one of you could recommend a professional calligrapher for an illustration I hope to commission. This will be for silkscreened apparel. I would like to have the same Spencerian style one sees applied to birds, fruit, feathers, etc. applied to a more modern subject such as a tank, bomber, grenade, etc. The effect is intended to be ironic…a beautifully human and fragile depiction of an instrument of death.

I am attaching an image to give you some idea of what I hope to emulate. It is a meager example of the craft, but all I have currently available.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [ornament.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20070318050636/http:/typophile.com/files/ornament_0.jpg) | 48.81 KB |
author: tflavin

comments.content: you might want to contact the guys at [House Industries](http://web.archive.org/wiki/House%20Industries) or [Mark Simonson](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Mark%20Simonson). Otherwise, you might try looking for a local calligrapher’s society?
Thanks for your reply. Do you think most letterers can do penwork that complex?

Great idea.

Paul’s suggestions are good. Also [Charles Borges](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Charles%20Borges), [Jill Bell](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Jill%20Bell), and [Tom Carnase](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Tom%20Carnase).

There is an artist who does many of these of swirly motifs- and they have (the technique that is ) a slight edginess that the other designer here seem not to have. Of course, I forgot the link or his name.

But I saved one his illustrations on my hard drive for cases just like this- I guess.

Stephan Coles would definitely know who I’m talking about.

Mikey :-)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/files/113833607_146035c80d_3679.jpg)

Sharon\> Thank you for helping me out. I thought I was gonna go crazy!

tflavin\> Ray Fenwick is the man question!

Mike Diaz :-)

You’re welcome, Mike.

I love Si Scott, too. [http://www.siscottdesign.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20070318050636/http:/www.siscottdesign.com/)

Sharon

For Spencerian Script the one guy I am aware of is Michael Sull. There is an e-mail link for him on this page. My Mother took classes with him, and I can attest to the fact that he is amazing…

[http://www.spencerian.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20070318050636/http:/www.spencerian.com/)

\*EDIT: the sample you have provided was done by Elvis Swift (or at least it exactly duplicates his style). Link below. A true spencerian ornament will be much more elegant, and not as bold and graphic. So you may not want a true Spencerian treatment if you’re wanting to match your sample…

[Elvis Swift on AltPick.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20070318050636/http:/altpick.com/members.php?id=17873)

Ohhh… I love Elvis Swift’s work… I remember an old call for entries for Strathmore papers- he did a lovely scrolly lady

Mikey :-)

Thank you all for your suggestions! I appreciate your help. Oh…and I am wanting a true Spencerian ornament. The example I found was the best I could find to convey the proper idea. What I am looking for is more delicate, whimsical, hand crafted.

You are very welcome! It helped us too!

Mikey :-)
